fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes

Interface ITemplateHash<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the key type used to manipulate the dictionary.
    V - the value type contained in the dictionary.

    public interface ITemplateHash<K,V>
    Container for a key-value dictionary in a template dataset, that can transform arbitrary key types into key types as expected by the template system, with a fluent API for adding items. For example, with the FreeMarker template system, hash keys must be strings.

    Invocations of put can be chained, to make it easier to write concise code.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    ITemplateData.createHash(String)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V item(K itemKey)
      Gets the item in this dictionary with the specified key, if any.
      ITemplateHash<K,V> put(K itemKey, V item)
      Adds an item into this dictionary with the specified key.
      ITemplateHash<K,V> putAll(Map<? extends K,? extends V> map)
      Adds a collection of keys and values to this dictionary instance, transforming keys if necessary.
      V remove(K itemKey)
      Removes the item in this dictionary with the specified key, if it exists (and returning it if it does).
      int size()
      Gets the number of keys in this key-value dictionary.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        int size()
        Gets the number of keys in this key-value dictionary.
        Returns:
        the number of keys.
        Since:
        1.0

      • item

        V item(K itemKey)
        Gets the item in this dictionary with the specified key, if any.
        Parameters:
        itemKey - the key used when adding the item. Internally, the template system may transform the key into another object type, so the key used must support such transformations (for example, key transformation may be applied using Object.toString()). The template system may accept an already-transformed key, however as different template systems may use different transformations, using already-transformed keys is not recommended.
        Returns:
        the item, if found, or null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • remove

        V remove(K itemKey)
        Removes the item in this dictionary with the specified key, if it exists (and returning it if it does).
        Parameters:
        itemKey - the key used when adding the item. Internally, the template system may transform the key into another object type, so the key used must support such transformations (for example, key transformation may be applied using Object.toString()). The template system may accept an already-transformed key, however as different template systems may use different transformations, using already-transformed keys is not recommended.
        Returns:
        the item that was removed, or null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • put

        ITemplateHash<K,V> put(K itemKey,
                       V item)
        Adds an item into this dictionary with the specified key. The order of insertion is preserved. If the same key is reused, then only the most-recently added value is retained.
        Parameters:
        itemKey - the key used to identify the item. The template system may transform the key to make it compatible with the template engine (for example, by converting it to a string or otherwise serializing the item).
        item - the item to put into the dictionary.
        Returns:
        this template hash instance, for chaining method calls.
        Since:
        1.0

      • putAll

        ITemplateHash<K,V> putAll(Map<? extends K,? extends V> map)
        Adds a collection of keys and values to this dictionary instance, transforming keys if necessary. The order of insertion is preserved, where the insertion order is defined by the supplied map's iterator. If the same key is reused, then only the most-recently added value is retained.
        Parameters:
        map - contains the collection of keys and values to put into this dictionary.
        Returns:
        this template hash instance, for chaining method calls.
        Since:
        1.0
